title: Sophie Harwood signs professional contract
body_text:
We’re delighted to announce that Sophie Harwood has put pen to paper on her first professional contract with us.
The 18-year-old full-back joined our academy from Southampton in July 2024 and has gone on to become a key part of our under-21s set-up.
The England under-20s international got her first taste of senior action in the summer of 2025, coming off the bench in our pre-season friendlies against Tottenham Hotspur and West Ham United at Meadow Park.
In addition to her development with our academy, Sophie has been a regular member of our matchday squads for both Barclays Women’s Super League and UEFA Champions League fixtures, gaining valuable first-team experience.
At international level, Sophie’s helped the England under-17s reach the semi-finals of the European Championships at the age of just 15, later captaining England at both under-16 and under-17 level. In total, Sophie has made 34 appearances for the Young Lionesses in all competitions.
“Signing my first professional contract for Arsenal is a proud and special moment for me,” said Sophie. “Arsenal have paved the way for women’s football for so long, and to be able to play at such a historic club means so much to me. Every time I wear the badge, I’ll give my all and wear it with pride. Arsenal is a special club with special people and supporters – I’m thrilled to have signed.”
Technical Director Jodie Taylor added: “Sophie has impressed since joining the club and has settled into our first-team environment extremely well. We’re looking forward to supporting her continued development as she takes this next step in her career.”
Director of Women’s Football Clare Wheatley said: “We’re thrilled that Sophie has put pen to paper on professional terms with Arsenal. Sophie has shown great playmaking ability and versatility in the full-back position, and with hard work and dedication, we believe she has high potential in the professional game.”
Everyone at the club would like to congratulate Sophie and we all look forward to seeing her continued development at the club.
